name: ProcureAI Bot
description: An AI‑powered procurement assistant that automates request‑for‑quotation (RFQ) creation, performs spend analytics, searches and compares vendors, applies compliance rules, and generates ready‑to‑sign contracts, all via conversational interaction.

tools.name: spend_data_query
tools.description: Queries the company's spend database for historical purchase data filtered by category, time range, and internal cost centre.

category.description: Spend category (e.g., office supplies, IT hardware).

tools.name: vendor_search
tools.description: Searches a vetted vendor marketplace for suppliers matching a product or service description, returning key metrics such as rating, certifications, and average lead time.

search_query.description: Free‑text description of the required product or service.

max_results.description: Maximum number of vendors to return.

required_certifications.description: List of certifications the vendor must hold (e.g., ISO‑9001).

tools.name: rfq_template_generator
tools.description: Generates a structured RFQ document (Markdown) based on user‑provided specifications, selected vendors, and compliance constraints.

description.description: Detailed description of the goods or services needed.

vendors.description: List of vendor IDs and names to which the RFQ will be sent.

tools.name: compliance_check
tools.description: Validates a procurement request against enterprise compliance policies such as spend caps, preferred‑vendor lists, and sustainability criteria.

amount.description: Estimated total spend for the request.

vendor_ids.description: IDs of the vendors selected for the request.

sustainability_requirements.description: Whether the request must meet sustainability criteria.

tools.name: contract_generator
tools.description: Creates a legally‑reviewed contract (Markdown) from an accepted RFQ, inserting terms, payment schedule, and SLA clauses.

vendor_id.description: ID of the vendor that won the bid.

tools.name: email_send
tools.description: Sends an email with optional attachments to a list of recipients.

body.description: Plain‑text or Markdown body of the email.

tools.name: spreadsheet_update
tools.description: Updates a procurement tracking spreadsheet (e.g., Google Sheets) with new rows or changed cells.

examples.description: User requests an RFQ for office supplies after the bot analyses last quarter's spend, finds suitable vendors, checks compliance, creates the RFQ document and emails it to the vendors.

messages.content: You are ProcureAI, a conversational procurement assistant. Use the provided tools to gather spend data, locate vendors, validate compliance, generate RFQs and contracts, and communicate with stakeholders.
We need to refresh our office supplies for Q1 2025. Please create an RFQ for pens, paper, and printer cartridges based on our last quarter's spend and send it to a few vetted vendors.
Sure, let me pull the spend data for office supplies from Q4 2024 to understand volumes and spend.

{"total_spend": 8425.73, "items": [{"name": "Ballpoint pens", "quantity": 1200}, {"name": "A4 paper (500 sheets)", "quantity": 800}, {"name": "Printer cartridges", "quantity": 150}], "top_vendors": [{"vendor_id": "v001", "vendor_name": "OfficeSuppliesCo"}, {"vendor_id": "v004", "vendor_name": "PaperWorks Ltd"}]}
Got the spend data. I’ll look for additional vetted vendors that meet our ISO‑9001 certification requirement.

[{"vendor_id": "v001", "vendor_name": "OfficeSuppliesCo", "rating": 4.7, "lead_time_days": 5}, {"vendor_id": "v004", "vendor_name": "PaperWorks Ltd", "rating": 4.5, "lead_time_days": 7}, {"vendor_id": "v009", "vendor_name": "StationeryPlus", "rating": 4.6, "lead_time_days": 4}]
Here are three suitable vendors. Next I’ll verify that the planned spend of $8,425.73 stays within our $10,000 quarterly cap for office supplies.
{"compliant": true, "notes": "Spend below cap and all vendors have sustainability certifications."}
All compliance checks passed. I’ll now generate the RFQ document and email it to the vendors.

arguments.sla: Machine to be fully operational within 7 days of installation; 2‑year parts warranty.

messages.content:
# Procurement Contract – CNC Milling Machine

**Vendor:** IndustrialBots (v103)

**Reference RFQ:** rfq_cnc_2025_01

**Scope:** Supply, install, and commission a 5‑axis CNC milling machine (model IB‑CNC‑5000).

**Price:** $46,000 (inclusive of installation)

**Payment Terms:** 30 days net after successful delivery and acceptance.

**Warranty:** 2 years parts and labor warranty.

**Service Level Agreement (SLA):**
- Installation and commissioning to be completed within 7 business days of delivery.
- Vendor to provide on‑site training (3 days) and a dedicated support line.

**Compliance:**
- Spend under $50,000 cap.
- Vendor holds ISO‑9001 and ISO‑14001 certifications.
- Sustainability requirements satisfied.

*Signed by Procurement Lead:* ____________________  *Date:* __________

*Signed by Vendor Representative:* ____________________  *Date:* __________
The contract has been generated. I’ll email it to IndustrialBots for signature and archive a copy in the procurement tracker.
